articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday will implement tariffs of 25% on Canadian and Mexican imports and 10% on Chinese goods with immediate effect, White House spokesperson Karoline Leavitt said on Friday.
articles.title: White House says Trump to impose Canada, Mexico, China tariffs on Saturday

articles.author: David Shepardson, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Investigators plan to push forward on Friday with efforts to retrieve the two aircraft involved in a crash in Washington that killed 67 people and raised questions about air safety in the U.S. capital.
articles.title: Investigators seek to salvage aircraft after deadly Washington crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Friday it would free the father of the youngest hostages seized in its Oct. 7, 2023 attack on Israel and two others including a dual U.S. citizen in the next exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners.
articles.title: Hamas names Israeli hostages to be freed on Saturday

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The U.N. Palestinian relief agency said its humanitarian work across the occupied territories and Gaza was still ongoing on Friday despite an Israeli ban that took effect a day before and what it described as hostility towards its staff.
articles.title: UNRWA carries on aid work despite Israeli ban, hostilities

articles.author: Marianna Parraga, Elida Moreno
articles.description: Some U.S. lawmakers and officials are touting a nearly half-century-old treaty between the United States and Panama to justify the Trump administration's threat to reclaim the Panama Canal - provided it can show the strategic waterway's operation is under threat.
articles.title: Why the US is claiming China’s presence violates the Panama neutrality treaty

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Steve Holland, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The Trump administration is considering scaling down the U.S. Agency for International Development and putting it under control of the State Department, two sources familiar with the discussions said on Friday, in a significant overhaul of how Washington allocates U.S. foreign aid worldwide.
articles.title: Trump administration explores bringing USAID under State Department, sources say

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: Friedrich Merz, hitherto favourite to become Germany's next chancellor, suffered a blow three weeks before a national election on Friday when 12 of his own legislators refused to support him in backing a migration bill that thereby failed to pass in parliament.
articles.title: Migration law gamble backfires for Germany's conservative chancellor hopeful

articles.author: David Lewis, Sonia Rolley
articles.description: As Rwanda-backed M23 rebels in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo push south towards the city of Bukavu, they are likely to have to fight their way through thousands of troops from Burundi, ramping up the risk of a return to full-blown regional war.
articles.title: M23 rebels face Burundian forces in eastern Congo, heightening war fears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syrian authorities have arrested a former senior security officer and cousin of ousted leader Bashar al-Assad seen by some as responsible for sparking the country's 2011 uprising due to a crackdown on protests in the southern city of Daraa, state media said.
articles.title: Syria arrests Assad-era officer seen as responsible for triggering 2011 uprising

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Paolo Chiriatti
articles.description: A Rome court on Friday ordered a group of migrants detained in camps built in Albania to be transferred to Italy, sources said, dealing a fresh blow to a plan by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni to curb irregular sea arrivals.
articles.title: Italy court again blocks migrant detentions in Albania, in blow to Meloni
